title: Rully Nere
text:
Rully Rudolf Nere is an Indonesian <a href="association%20football">football</a> head coach who currently coached <a href="Indonesia%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Indonesia women's national football team</a>.
A player for <a href="Persipura%20Jayapura">Persipura Jayapura</a> in the 1980s, Nere was also a part of <a href="Indonesia%20national%20football%20team">Indonesia national football team</a> in the same period, including the squad which won the gold medal of <a href="1987%20Southeast%20Asian%20Games">1987 Southeast Asian Games</a> <a href="Football%20at%20the%201987%20Southeast%20Asian%20Games">football tournament</a> on home soil, where he laid the assist for the only goal by Ribut Waidi in the final against <a href="Malaysia%20national%20football%20team">Malaysia</a>.
Nere was also held the post as Director of <a href="Persatuan%20Sepakbola%20Seluruh%20Indonesia">PSSI</a> Youth Development from 2003 to 2007.
His son, Mitchell Nere, is a footballer playing for same club he managed, Pro Titan.
Head coaching career.
He managed several clubs during his career as a head coach.
On 5 March 2015, Rully Nere appointed by the <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Indonesia">Football Association of Indonesia</a> as the <a href="Indonesia%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Indonesia women's national football team</a> coach.
